Mike,

Thank you very much for this well formulated question.  Normally 
questions are more "how can I test this or that?" ...

The Swing application implements it's own ClassLoader and this result 
into several problems.  I'm not 100% sure of the solution but try to 
define your junit task with a 'fork="yes"' parameter.  If I remember 
well, this solves some problems with the ClassLoader.

>             <junit printsummary="on" fork="yes">

                                        ^^^^^^^^^^


>                 <formatter type="plain"/>  
>                 <classpath refid="junitpath"/>
>               <!-- <classpaty refid="classpath"/>-->
>                 <test
> name="ewm.timepay.empassign.model.EmpAssignModelTest"/>
>             </junit>


Hope it helps,


-Vladimir
